intro: Aeschynomene latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a hairy surface. It produces small, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in clusters. Aeschynomene latifolia is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to fix nitrogen and tolerate poor soil conditions.
